summary: 4-WHEEL DRIVE DOES NOT WORK WITH ONLY 38,770 MILES ON 2000 FORD EXPLORER AND FORD WILL NOT FIX IT UNDER COVERED EXPENSES EVEN THOUGH WE DON'T KNOW HOW LONG IT HAS BEEN BROKEN. HIGH AND LOW LIGHT UP ON DASH BOARD AND WHEN PUT IN DRIVE, IT MAKES THE THUMP AS THOUGH IT IS IN 4 WHEEL DRIVE. WE THOUGHT ALL ALONG IT WAS WORKING UNTIL WE GOT HUNG UP 2 WEEKS AGO IN A DRIVE WAY AND THE FRONT WHEELS WOULD NOT MOVE. I THINK IT WAS BROKE BEFORE THE 36000 MILE WARRANTY EXPIRED. BUT FORD WILL NOT CONSIDER FIXING IT WITHOUT US PAYING FOR IT.  *JB
